column4: ok so one last question before I find something new to ask questions about
I start steam from a terminal window, but once steam has started, is it ok to close the terminal?
or will that close the whole thing
oh hmm
wine steam.exe
gotcha
well eventually I will just make a script so I can have like a quicklaunch shortcut type deal, I can do that, right?
is this a steam server or client
nautilus is not running, you can restart X and it should fix it
what is nautilus?
ubuntus window manager....also a file manager
you can run nautilus from the command line, but you'll be left with an open terminal window
if you close the window it will still terminate
as someone mentioned earlier that only backgrounds the process
did you use compiz --replace or nautilus
thats exactly what i was gonna recommend
are you running steam client or server
does it run well, I have not had alot of luck performance wise with wine
even simple non-graphic progs run slow
definitely, pm me and tell me how it hoes, I am takin my a$$ to bed
...goes
